006
007package renderer.scene.primitives;
008
009import java.util.List;
010
011/**
012   A {@code Points} object has {@code n} integers that
013   represent points in space and another {@code n}
014   integers that represent the {@link java.awt.Color} at
015   each of those points.
016<p>
017   The integers are indices into the {@link renderer.scene.Vertex}
018   and {@link java.awt.Color} lists of a {@link renderer.scene.Model}
019   object.
020*/
021public class Points extends Primitive
022{
023   public int radius = 0;
024
025   /**
026      Construct a {@code Points} with the given array of indices for
027      the {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} and {@link java.awt.Color} index lists.
028      <p>
029      NOTE: This constructor does not put any {@link renderer.scene.Vertex}
030      or {@link java.awt.Color} objects into this {@link Primitive}'s
031      {@link renderer.scene.Model} object. This constructor assumes that
032      the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this
033      {@link Primitive} gets rendered).
034
035      @param indices  array of {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} and {@link java.awt.Color} indices to place in this {@code Points}
036   */
037   public Points(final int... indices)
038   {
039      super(indices);
040   }
041
042
043   /**
044      Construct a {@code Points} object using the two given
045      {@link List}s of integer indices.
046      <p>
047      NOTE: This constructor does not put any {@link renderer.scene.Vertex}
048      or {@link java.awt.Color} objects into this {@link Primitive}'s
049      {@link renderer.scene.Model} object. This constructor assumes that
050      the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this
051      {@link Primitive} gets rendered).
052
053      @param vIndexList  {@link List} of integer indices into a {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} list
054      @param cIndexList  {@link List} of integer indices into a {@link java.awt.Color} list
055   */
056   public Points(final List<Integer> vIndexList,
057                 final List<Integer> cIndexList)
058   {
059      super(vIndexList, cIndexList);
060   }
061
062
063   /**
064      For debugging.
065
066      @return {@link String} representation of this {@code Points} object
067   */
068   @Override
069   public String toString()
070   {
071      String result =  "Points: ([";
072      for (int i = 0; i < vIndexList.size() - 1; ++i)
073      {
074         result += vIndexList.get(i) + ", ";
075      }
076      result += vIndexList.get(vIndexList.size() - 1) + "], [";
077      for (int i = 0; i < cIndexList.size() - 1; ++i)
078      {
079         result += cIndexList.get(i) + ", ";
080      }
081      result += cIndexList.get(cIndexList.size() - 1) + "]) radius = " + radius;
082      return result;
083   }
084}
